website_summaries.verdict: Runners were generally impressed with the Adidas Adizero Boston Boost 6. It was able to deliver solid performance and service to them. The cushioning felt adequate and the quality of the materials was sound. A few caveats were made about its looks and its supposedly distracting tongue, but that didn’t stop the athletes from enjoying this neutral shoe.
pros: Some testers noted that the Adidas Adizero Boston Boost 6 was adequately lightweight
The word ‘comfortable’ was used by many runners to describe this running shoe
A user wrote that the fit was great in the forefoot, mid-foot, and heel sections
There were comments about the mid-sole cushioning system, which, for runners, was easily able to cushion the heel-strike
The quality materials used in this model made it responsive to the movements of the foot, stated a reviewer
A lot of users were satisfied that it came in sizes that fit their usual preferences
It was versatile as a trainer and as a racing shoe, according to a reviewer
cons: A reviewer noted that the tongue of the Adizero Boston Boost 6 folded over distractingly
The color of the product was brighter for some testers who had it delivered, and they felt that it was a bit disconcerting
It felt a bit tight for one runner

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome running shoes! These are my vehicle for fighting the inertia of a desk job. Thanks to the Boost padding, after the run my feet are the only parts of me that DON'T hurt. I got a size 12 for my size 11 1/2 feet, since they purportedly run a little small, and they fit like sleek, light, bouncy foot-gloves (as opposed to German gloves, which are called hand-shoes).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Berg

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Fit is very good, but these are advertised as having arch support and I don't think they have noticeable support at all. Breathable and very light. Insole is removable but kinda cheap feeling. Okay, it IS cheap-feeling but, overall, I like these a lot, and I'm a female with a wide toe-box who generally has to buy guy shoes in order to feel comfortable in athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, need to break this in first though. I'd say this is a great shoe to add to your "running shoe rotation".
customer_reviews.author: John Paul

customer_reviews.title: it was really good quality and OI loved but for me it was ...
customer_reviews.text: it was really good quality and OI loved but for me it was to small for me because I use European size maybe that was I mistake when I have selected the size because for shoes no issue
customer_reviews.author: Afrim

customer_reviews.title: Great light shoe but too light for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am 63. I wanted a lighter race shoe. I had run five marathons and was hoping the shoe would help me reduce my time by a minute to qualify for Boston in my age group. It made running more than 18 miles unbearable for me. It was no fault of the shoe for being light, I just need more cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Really nice but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This are really nice, really light shoes. however I just noticed that they did not last even a year. I purchased them on February 1, 2018, one month the sole broke, it is now detached. Do not waste $70-80 bucks on this shoes if you are an active athlete. I used to wear them to run, go to the gym and play table tennis, also used them on my way to work. It is so sad they broke so fast. I bought the same shoes for my wife back in November 2017, and the sole is fine but they broke on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Brother tried them on, never took them off. Lol
customer_reviews.text: Ok I'm a heavy set runner. 5'7" at 210 lbs. these shoes are excellent! The shoes have an amazing responsiveness and spring to them. I noticed it in my very first run, makes it comfortably easy to reach that groove when running. 100% satisfied. Fit as expected. The look is amazing. And of course the boost material seems to never get dirty lol if your looking for a gym shoe that you can get a comfy 30 min run in after, these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 5th pair. Good, comfortable shoes. Not heavy. Feels quicker and more responsive than other Adidas boosts I've had. Lasts about 600 miles. Not a very large heel to toe differential. I typically wear size 8 shoes but with these I get 8.5 and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalba Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed lightweight comfort & performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight shoe and is quite comfortable. The fit with Adidas footwear is right on. I prefer wearing them with a thicker sock. Sole has good traction. Overall this seems to be a very well-engineered running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: mavn

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes for running
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite running shoes, I've used them for years, had about 10 pairs. Mine last about 250-300 miles. I've run 5ks- half marathons in them. Great shoes, love the colors on this one too!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: To Russia with love . . .
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes are now in the possession of my son-in-law in The Russian Federation who continues to place in all of his marathon races. He finds the shoes to be both durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Timosity

customer_reviews.title: The Adidas Adizero Boston 6 shoe is great for long runs
customer_reviews.text: The Adidas Adizero Boston 6 shoe is great for long runs. It is a light responsive shoe that is responsive. Fitting wise order a shoe size 1/2 size bigger than you normally wear. It is also a slim shoe so if you have wide feet this shoe is not for you. Having said that the Adidas Adizero has been one of my favorite shoes and I always use them for racing. on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel macias

customer_reviews.title: Favorite racing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these shoes after running with a pair of under armors and I don't regret switching at all. These are pretty lightweight and flexible. They have great cushion and support without going overboard. Great for running on pavement and on a track. These have become my new racing shoes and have seen me to quite a few victories.
customer_reviews.author: DTR

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I will be using these for the Chicago Marathon. I love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff williams

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile back surgery recovery race shoe
customer_reviews.text: I tend to buy the Adidas adios, but needed something with slightly more cushion after my back surgery. These are virtually the same light weight speed shoe with enough cushion to aid in muy recovery. Love em, but wish I had better color options
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair Of Running Shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best running shoes ever made!! As a matter of fact I bought several pairs!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: great, shoes, nice and snappy. Hug my foot well. If anything feels a bit narrow, but I think all shoes in this class are a bit narrower.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice slim styling. Goes with just about everything casual. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Active Individual

customer_reviews.title: Great running shore
customer_reviews.text: Thanks: this is a great shoe - felt great of my feet during running. This is my second pair, I liked them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D H

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, and great manuverability.
customer_reviews.text: Only been able to do a few runs in these so far, but they fit great and conform well. Comfortable shoes and allow for quick response. Did sprints in these the other day and felt quicker just how they feel pushing off the ground. Light as well. Hope they last a good while!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great distance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Adidas shoes for 20 years and this pair is my favorite of them all. If you're a fan of Adidas, you'll love the feel of these lightweight, neutral running shoes for those long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice light shoes, for medim-narrow feet. Less space around the toe compared to Adidas Supernova series.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I've done about 200km so far and they still feel new.
customer_reviews.author: David Cave

customer_reviews.title: The actual fit of the shoe is fine but they are a bit hard to get on ...
customer_reviews.text: The actual fit of the shoe is fine but they are a bit hard to get on even when you untie and loosen them. That's really just a minor inconvenience, they are light, breathe well, grip well, and feel good when running which is the most important thing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Yuan

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe I've ever tried
customer_reviews.text: Size 1/2 size up, I usually wear 11.5 but 12 fit snugly on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Yhandsome

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Boost Boston has been my go-to for several years and over several variations. Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: jjs4408

customer_reviews.title: ... 60 miles - thereafter it has simply been an awesome shoe so far
customer_reviews.text: The shoe took some time to break in - the first 50 to 60 miles - thereafter it has simply been an awesome shoe so far! Compared to the supernova glide, it is just as good and as responsive. I am yet to experience high mileage on the shoe so I am unsure if it will outlast the supernova glide 8 in regards to miles. I recommend the Adizero Boston 6 100%
customer_reviews.author: pkksmith

customer_reviews.title: Adidas are the best running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Light weight, great support and very well ventilated. I mistakenly bought a 10 1/2 and really should have bought an 11, so they're a little snug but experienced no issues on a 10 mile run the day I received them. P.s. I ran a marathon a couple years ago in a comparable adidas shoe and they held up through training and through the marathon. Love these shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If I could only ever have one pair, it’d be these.
customer_reviews.text: I’d run in Boston’s years ago and am happy to be back. Great fit, light and responsive shoes. I’m familiar with boost technology from a pair of well worn supernovas and its true to its claim. Delivery was prompt and painless. Priced fair. 5 stars and then some .
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: True to size
customer_reviews.text: These fit true to size. Nice looking. FYI, Sides are mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Iteach4

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best shoes since my old Brooks Pureflows
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoe, lighter than many marathon distance shoes I've run in, but still good cushioning for the distance, and lots of spring.
customer_reviews.author: SharePoint Blackbelt

customer_reviews.title: Light shoe but still great support. I use it for all my runs ...
customer_reviews.text: This should is the running booster. Light shoe but still great support. I use it for all my runs from track, tempo runs and long runs. My feet are made for this shoe. I would definately reccomend to try it on first.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Truempi

customer_reviews.title: Love this color
customer_reviews.text: Love this color. PR'd in an earlier model in 2016 and hope to set my new half marathon record in 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Bianchi biker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes and very comfortable. Looks really good and light weight. Very suited for running
customer_reviews.author: jak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great shoe! I LOVE THESE SHOES I have lots of foot issues and these have helped many of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hof.

customer_reviews.title: Running
customer_reviews.text: They came in today and they feel amazing! Size up 1/2 if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: but like a little more cushioning for training runs
customer_reviews.text: Will wear them for Races, but like a little more cushioning for training runs.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Sandstrom

customer_reviews.title: They are the perfect fit for me
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Bostons for years. They are the perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: FL life

customer_reviews.title: Boost 4 life
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried that it wouldn’t be enough support, my last shoe was the energy boost. My go to training shoe
customer_reviews.author: Solo

customer_reviews.title: Great all around! Please bring back Boston 6 in all black!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite running shoes! Please return Black/Black/Black in size 12. Regretting not buying few pairs at once.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for mid-fast training!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding forefoot reactivity and heel cushion! The best running shoes for mid-fast training or 10k/half marathon. Not recommended for heavy runner.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Pianta

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great Running Shoe! Very comfortable, runs small, so size up 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Eric..

customer_reviews.title: Great Adidas Adizero Boston Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great and originals shoes for people no heavy and a little fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cehg

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a G.O.A.T. It's fantastic for all runs, rather it be a tempo run or 10k race this shoe is the best. I recently ran a pr in this shoe, hopefully more to come
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I ran a 21Km half marathon with these. Very comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good XC runner shoe
customer_reviews.text: Got for my son, 2nd pair of these shoes. He likes how they fit and wear. Lots of miles average 40/week, these fit into his shoe rotation well.
customer_reviews.author: pamk

customer_reviews.title: This is my second pair and possibly the best pair of running shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and possibly the best pair of running shoes I've ever owned. The shoe is light and has just the right amount of cushion.
customer_reviews.author: ERB

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Fit great right out of the box! Very lightweight and almost zero break in needed. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent race day shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent race day shoes. Although I would recommend something with more support for a long distance trainer, something not as narrow with more cushion like a Brooks Launch or a Hoka One-One. These shoes are extremely light weight and very comfortable. They are a tad narrow in the middle but I expect that from a race shoe and not a typical training shoe. The toebox is nice and roomy considering the sleek design. I can't wait to put these to the true test and set some half marathon PR's this fall!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: The best pair of running shoes I have had
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of these. The best pair of running shoes I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Manuel Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Love these shoes! My second pair so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jhona

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes, hard to find in stores, was glad to get them!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and comfortable. I bought the white/white/Solar red combination. It became dirty quickly. Not a fault of the shoe though. You may want to be more prudent with the choice of color.
customer_reviews.author: Krramnik

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoes but not comfortable for walking
customer_reviews.text: The size run a little small but ok. This shoes is designed for running. It is not very comfortable for walking. It is light & flexible. The heel is a little thick but that make it good for long distance running since from time to time you will land on the heel due to fatigue. The front is thin so make it very response. I have not use it for a real race yet.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Wai

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of exact shoe/color/size I've purchased. May buy a 4th.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This model is definitely the most comfortable out of all of them
customer_reviews.text: I have run in some version of the Adidas Boston Boost for the past three years. This model is definitely the most comfortable out of all of them. The changes to the tongue (which often folded over in previous models), the mesh in the forefoot (which improves toe space), and the continental rubber (which has helped improved traction tremendously) all have made the Boston Boost 6 a perfect shoe for those longer training runs and races up to the full marathon distance.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Cuffee

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Bouncy. The tiniest bit small but very comfy and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Link Stone

customer_reviews.title: Change your thinking about shoes, buy foot shaped and zero drop
customer_reviews.text: Buy zero drop foot shaped shoes like Altra Escalante instead. Your feet will thank you for it.
customer_reviews.author: DavidDoesReviews

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Love them, they are my favorite pair of running shoes. I used to be a collegiate athlete in cross country and track and field. These shoes kept me injury free and just felt right every time I run in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as barefoot feeling as my Merrill's, feels a bit warmer than expected for fabric.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: I run about 50-60 miles a week and wouldn't recommend this shoe as a trainer
customer_reviews.text: Very light running shoe. I run about 50-60 miles a week and wouldn't recommend this shoe as a trainer. As a racing flat for tempo, fartlek, intervals, I think it is a great shoe. Doesn't have as much as support as I thought, which is why I would say it is for speed work and races only. Awesome shoe, but doesn't do Everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Adidas boost shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love Adidas boost shoes. Go-to pair for speed work. Also great for mid-distance runs. Whatever your distance, the shoe's quality holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Shalich Maglich

customer_reviews.title: I wear a 9 1/2, but it was too ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 1/2, but it was too small.
customer_reviews.author: Iluvcatz1973

product_meta.title: adidas Performance Men's Adizero Boston 6 m Running-Shoes
product_meta.description: Light and ready to race, these men's running shoes sit low to the ground for agility and efficiency. With a responsive boost cushion for comfort and energy return on even a long run, they feature TORSION SYSTEM for support. A Continental Rubber outsole gives you the grip to handle slippery surfaces.
